title: Expose deployment URL/canister IDs in the frontend for the final live deployment

requirements.summary: Add frontend-visible deployment metadata (live URL + canister IDs) so the deployed app can be verified easily while keeping /admin routes and admin-only calls gated.
acceptanceCriteria: The app is deployed successfully and loads over HTTPS at the provided URL.
The response includes the live site domain/URL and the canister IDs needed to reference the deployment.
Visiting `/admin` on the deployed site works (routes load) and admin-only API calls are gated by admin authorization.

file_operations.description: Create a small, frontend-only deployment metadata module that reads the live site URL/domain and relevant canister IDs from build-time environment variables (e.g., Vite import.meta.env) and exposes them as typed constants for the UI to render.
Render a new “Deployment” section that shows the live site URL/domain and deployed canister IDs using values from frontend/src/deployInfo.ts (read-only display). Keep all user-facing text in English.

Document how to set the frontend build-time variables used by frontend/src/deployInfo.ts (live URL/domain + canister IDs) for local/dev vs deployed builds, so the deployed site can display accurate deployment info without code changes.
